charter.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a statement of the principles, duties, and purposes of an organization
charter.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: the freedoms embodied in the UN charter
charter.translation[0].definitions[1].de: the practice of paying money to a company to use their boats, aircraft etc, or the boat, aircraft etc used in this way
charter.translation[0].definitions[2].de: a signed statement from a government or ruler which allows a town, organization, or university to officially exist and have special rights
charter.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The town’s charter was granted in 1838.
charter.translation[0].definitions[3].de: a law or official decision that seems to give someone the right to do something most people consider morally wrong
charter.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: Reducing the number of police is just a thieves’ charter.
charter.translation[1].definitions[0].de: to pay a company for the use of their aircraft, boat etc
charter.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: We chartered a boat to take us to some of the smaller islands.
charter.translation[1].definitions[1].de: to say officially that a town, organization, or university officially exists and has special rights
charter.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to pay for the use of a plane, boat, train etc for a particular period of time or a particular journey
charter.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The US government has chartered 41 commercial vessels to carry equipment to the Mideast.
charter.translation[2].definitions[1].de: to officially allow a financial institution to operate in a particular place
charter.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: Banks chartered in Delaware are allowed to act as insurers.
charter.translation[3].definitions[0].de: an arrangement in which a person or organization pays a company to use its ships, aircraft etc
charter.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: Two of its ships were being repaired and unavailable for charter.
Charter rates (=rates charged for charter) for oil tankers have risen to more than $50,000 a day.
No ship without a charter party (=official contract between the owner and the user) could be loaded.
charter.translation[3].definitions[1].de: in the US, an official document that allows a business to operate and controls its activities
charter.translation[3].definitions[1].ex: The company was granted a New York state charter.
charter.translation[3].definitions[2].de: a statement of the principles, duties, and aims of an organization
